FormsAndValidations.description: Before submitting data to the server, it is important to ensure all required form controls are filled out, in the correct format. This is called client-side form validation, and helps ensure data submitted matches the requirements set forth in the various form controls.Visit the following resources to learn more:

resources.name: MDN Web Docs: Client-side form validation

questions.question: What is the 'required' attribute in HTML form elements used for?
questions.description: Explain the purpose of the 'required' attribute in HTML form elements.
questions.hint: Consider its role in ensuring that a field must be filled out before submitting the form.

options.label: A
options.description: To indicate that the input is optional.
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'required' attribute is used to specify that an input field must be filled out.

options.label: B
options.description: To specify a maximum character length for the input.
options.explanation: Not accurate. The 'required' attribute is not related to character length.

options.label: C
options.description: To indicate that the input must be filled out before submitting the form.
options.explanation: Correct! The 'required' attribute ensures that the associated input field must be filled out before form submission.

questions.question: How can you set a minimum and maximum value for a number input in HTML?

options.label: C
options.description: There is no way to set a range for a number input.
